body_html:
[build] update. A fresh git clone --recursive of the repo was the solution. Also, the final command to build was (likely some redundancy and not sure if I needed MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET or CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH for system Python install in this command, but here in case it helps anyone - I know it helps for conda Python installs):

MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.13 CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6" NO_CUDA=1 USE_CUDA=0 USE_NNPACK=0 NO_NNPACK=1 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python3 setup.py install

Leaving open for now, so that contributors can see if it's helpful (feel free to close anytime!). A suggestion would be to make sure when python setup.py clean is run that it deletes or renames the torch/lib/tmp_install folder.

body:
[build] update.  A fresh `git clone --recursive` of the repo was the solution.  Also, the final command to build was (likely some redundancy and not sure if I needed MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET or CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH for system Python install in this command, but here in case it helps anyone - I know it helps for conda Python installs):

`MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.13 CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6" NO_CUDA=1 USE_CUDA=0 USE_NNPACK=0 NO_NNPACK=1 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python3 setup.py install`

Leaving open for now, so that contributors can see if it's helpful (feel free to close anytime!).  A suggestion would be to make sure when `python setup.py clean` is run that it deletes or renames the `torch/lib/tmp_install` folder.
